diff_analysis.evidence: The new code (lines 44-49) introduces two vulnerabilities: cross-site scripting (CWE-79) and cross-site request forgery (CSRF) (CWE-352). The code allows users to enter HTML content in the `forward()` function, which can be used by an attacker to inject malicious JavaScript into the browser. Additionally, the code allows users to forge HTTP requests as an administrator, allowing them to perform actions without authorization.
